verses.text: Does not wisdom call out, and understanding raise her voice?
verses.comment: Wisdom is personified here, much like in earlier chapters. This sets the stage for wisdom’s public proclamation, inviting all to listen.

verses.text: On the heights by the road, at the crossroads, she stands.
verses.comment: Wisdom is accessible and positioned where all can see, emphasizing her universal call.

verses.text: Beside the gates at the entrance to the city, at the doors, she cries out:
verses.comment: Public places symbolize places of decision and commerce, showing wisdom seeks to guide all life’s affairs.

verses.text: To you, O people, I call, and my voice goes out to all mankind.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s invitation is for everyone, not just a particular group, emphasizing her universality and relevance for all ages.

verses.text: O simple ones, learn prudence; O fools, gain understanding.
verses.comment: A direct appeal to those lacking wisdom, showing that growth is possible through instruction and conversion of heart.

verses.text: Listen, for I speak noble things, and my lips declare what is right.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s words are both noble and true, distinguished from the deceptive words of folly.

verses.text: For my mouth speaks truth, and wickedness is detestable to my lips.
verses.comment: Truth is the core of wisdom; deception is directly opposed to it.

verses.text: All the words of my mouth are righteous; nothing twisted or crooked is in them.
verses.comment: Unlike human wisdom which may be imperfect, true wisdom is perfectly upright.

verses.text: They are all clear to those who understand, straight to those who find knowledge.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s teachings are plain to those open-hearted, a call to humility and receptivity.

verses.text: Receive my instruction instead of silver, and knowledge rather than choice gold.
verses.comment: Values wisdom above material wealth, echoing the call to treasure spiritual riches.

verses.text: For wisdom is better than jewels, and all that you may desire cannot compare with her.
verses.comment: The superior value of wisdom points to the pursuit of spiritual things above all else.

verses.text: I, wisdom, dwell with prudence, and I find knowledge and discretion.
verses.comment: Wisdom leads to a life of thoughtful action, not just intellectual knowledge.

verses.text: The fear of the LORD is hatred of evil. Pride and arrogance and the way of evil and perverted speech I hate.
verses.comment: Reverence for God involves turning away from all forms of sin. This is a call to personal holiness.

verses.text: I have counsel and sound wisdom; I have understanding; I have strength.
verses.comment: Wisdom not only provides guidance but also the fortitude to act rightly.

verses.text: By me kings reign, and rulers decree what is just.
verses.comment: The authority of leaders is established by wisdom; their legitimacy is rooted in the pursuit of justice.

verses.text: By me princes rule, and nobles, all who govern justly.
verses.comment: Good governance is intimately linked to wisdom’s presence, urging Christians to seek wise leaders.

verses.text: I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently find me.
verses.comment: Wisdom is given to those who earnestly seek, reflecting the principle of grace given in response to faith.

verses.text: Riches and honor are with me, enduring wealth and righteousness.
verses.comment: The blessings of wisdom include lasting wealth and virtue, contrasting with fleeting worldly success.

verses.text: My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold, and my yield than choice silver.
verses.comment: Spiritual fruit outlasts material rewards, a call to store up treasures in heaven.

verses.text: I walk in the way of righteousness, in the paths of justice,
verses.comment: Wisdom does not stray from truth or justice, inviting followers into a life of uprightness.

verses.text: so that I may give wealth to those who love me, and fill their treasuries.
verses.comment: God rewards spiritual pursuit, sometimes with material blessings, but always with spiritual abundance.

verses.text: The LORD possessed me at the beginning of his work, the first of his acts of old.
verses.comment: Wisdom existed before creation, mysteriously prefiguring Christ, ‘the Word’ (John 1:1), as divine wisdom.

verses.text: From everlasting I was established, from before the beginning, before the earth existed.
verses.comment: The eternal nature of wisdom recalls God’s uncreated existence, connecting with the eternal sonship.

verses.text: When there were no depths, I was brought forth, when there were no springs abounding with water.
verses.comment: Wisdom’s birth imagery is mysterious; the language points to her unique relationship with God’s creative act.

verses.text: Before the mountains were set in place, before the hills, I was brought forth;
verses.comment: Pre-existence before creation shows wisdom’s foundational role, sharing in God’s eternal plan.

verses.text: before he made the earth with its fields, or the first dust of the world.
verses.comment: Wisdom precedes all physical creation, again hinting at the eternal Word involved in all things made.

verses.text: When he established the heavens, I was there; when he drew a circle upon the face of the deep.
verses.comment: Wisdom is present at creation, foreshadowing Christ as co-creator (cf. John 1:3).

verses.text: When he made firm the skies above, when he established the fountains of the deep,
verses.comment: The description continues God’s creative acts; wisdom’s presence testifies to her divinely originated nature.

verses.text: when he assigned to the sea its boundary, so the waters would not overstep his command, when he marked out the foundations of the earth,
verses.comment: God’s sovereignty is shown here; wisdom is present as creation is ordered and governed.

verses.text: then I was beside him, like a master craftsman, and I was his delight day after day, rejoicing always before him,
verses.comment: Wisdom, as craftsman, echoes the concept of the ‘Word’ with God, intimate in creation and joy, reminiscent of eternal sonship.

verses.text: rejoicing in his inhabited world and delighting in the children of man.
verses.comment: Wisdom, reflecting God’s delight in creation, points to the benevolent relationship between divinity and humanity.

verses.text: Now therefore, listen to me, O children, for blessed are those who keep my ways.
verses.comment: Blessing is linked to hearing and obeying wisdom, reminiscent of the theme of covenant obedience.

verses.text: Hear instruction, and be wise, and do not neglect it.
verses.comment: Active listening leads to wisdom; abandonment of instruction leads to folly.

verses.text: Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting beside my doors.
verses.comment: The imagery recalls Mary sitting at Jesus’s feet (Luke 10:39), emphasizing daily devotion and spiritual seeking.

verses.text: For whoever finds me finds life and obtains favor from the LORD.
verses.comment: Wisdom brings true life, foreshadowing Christ as ‘the way, the truth, and the life’ (John 14:6).

verses.text: But whoever fails to find me injures himself; all who hate me love death.
verses.comment: To reject wisdom is to choose death; God’s revelation is essential for spiritual vitality, and participation in life is contingent on accepting divine wisdom.
